roles_and_contributions: Commander-in-chief of the Đại Việt army during the Trần Dynasty
Famous for his victories over the Mongol Empire during the invasions of Đại Việt in the 13th century

events_and_battles_participated.name: Battle of Bạch Đằng (1288)
events_and_battles_participated.description: Famous naval battle where Trần Hưng Đạo led Đại Việt forces to defeat the invading Mongol Empire

events_and_battles_participated.name: Third Mongol invasion of Đại Việt (1287–88)
events_and_battles_participated.description: Invasion by the Mongol Empire that was repelled by Trần Hưng Đạo's leadership

related_artifacts.name: Bạch Đằng Giang Chiến Kỷ
related_artifacts.description: A book about the Battle of Bạch Đằng written by Nguyễn Trãi, a famous Vietnamese poet and strategist

titles_and_honors: One of the Four Immortals of Đại Việt

roles_and_contributions: The legendary founder of the first Vietnamese state, Văn Lang, around 2879 BC

related_artifacts.name: Lac Long Quan Temple
related_artifacts.description: A temple in Hưng Yên Province dedicated to Lac Long Quan, the father of Hùng Vương

related_artifacts.name: Au Co Temple
related_artifacts.description: A temple in Phú Thọ Province dedicated to Au Co, the mother of Hùng Vương
